Package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework

Annotation Interface Test

@Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface Test
Annotate all methods in your test class which the framework should test with @Test.

Let m be a test method specifying the @Test annotation. If m is neither part of a checked test (an additional method specifying @Check with @Check(test = "m")) nor part of a custom run test (an additional method specifying @Run with @Run(test = "m")), then m is a so-called base test and the the framework invokes m in the following way:

  1. The framework warms m up by invoking it for a predefined number of iterations (default: 2000) or any number specified by an additional @Warmup annotation at m or by using TestFramework.setDefaultWarmup(int) (could also be 0 which skips the warm-up completely which is similar to simulating -Xcomp). More information about the warm-up in general can be found at Warmup

  2. After the warm-up, the framework compiles m at the specified compilation level set by compLevel() (default CompLevel.ANY will pick the highest available level which is usually CompLevel.C2).

  3. The framework invokes m one more time to run the compilation.

  4. The framework checks any specified @IR constraints at m. More information about IR matching can be found at IR.

m has the following properties:

  • If m specifies no parameters, the framework can directly invoke m.

  • If m specifies parameters, the framework needs to know how to invoke m. Use Arguments with Argument properties for each parameter to use well-defined parameters by the framework. If the method requires a more specific argument value, use a custom run test (see Run).

  • m cannot specify AbstractInfo or any of its subclasses as parameter or return type.

  • m is not inlined by the framework.

  • Verification of the return value of m can only be done in a checked test (see Check) or custom run test (see Run).

The following constraints must be met for the test method m specifying @Test:

  • m must be part of the test class. Using @Test in nested or helper classes is not allowed.

  • m cannot have the same name as another @Test method in the same test class. Method overloading is only allowed (but not encouraged) with other non-@Test methods.

  • m cannot specify any helper-method-specific compile command annotations (@ForceCompile, @DontCompile, @ForceInline, @DontInline).

Examples on how to write base tests can be found in BaseTestExample and also as part of the internal testing in the package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework.tests.

See Also:
Arguments

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    CompLevel
    compLevel
    Specify at which compilation level the framework should eventually compile the test method after an optional warm-up period.

  • Element Details

    • compLevel

      CompLevel compLevel
      Specify at which compilation level the framework should eventually compile the test method after an optional warm-up period. The default CompLevel.ANY will let the framework compile the method at the highest available level which is usually CompLevel.C2.
      Default:
      ANY
